sentences.cn: 如果你整批買這些東西的話是較便宜的。

sentences.en: The sales manager bullied these salesgirls into working hard by threatening them with dismissal.
sentences.cn: 那位銷售經理用解雇來威脅那些女店員努力工作。

sentences.en: The Bureau of Standards, Metrology & Inspection has put a ban on the product.
sentences.cn: 經濟部標準檢驗局已經禁止出售這種產品。

sentences.en: The peddler was bullied by that ferocious butcher in the market.
sentences.cn: 那個小販被市場上那個兇惡的屠夫欺負。

sentences.en: The cactuses in the flower shop still bulk large in her memory.
sentences.cn: 那家花店裡的仙人掌仍然讓她記憶猶新。

sentences.en: They planned to kill the fatted calf for Tom, the extraordinary salesman.
sentences.cn: 他們打算歡宴慶祝傑出推銷員─湯姆的到來。

sentences.en: She bought some ink, writing brushes and paper because she wanted to teach herself calligraphy.
sentences.cn: 她想自學書法，所以去買了墨水、毛筆和紙張。

sentences.en: If I had the chance, I would take the canal boat after coming back from shopping.
sentences.cn: 購物回來如果有機會，我要去坐運河船。

sentences.en: The little boy cannoned against a blind man on the corner in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在超市的轉彎處，那個小男孩撞上一位盲人。

sentences.en: He wanted to make a carbon copy of the shopping list.
sentences.cn: 他想用複寫紙複寫一份購物清單。

sentences.en: There is no need for anxiety about the sales of these cardboard boxes.
sentences.cn: 沒有必要為這些紙箱的銷售而擔心。

cn: 無憂無慮的，不負責任的

sentences.en: She seems to take a carefree attitude to the sales of those cookies.
sentences.cn: 她似乎並不為那些餅乾的銷售而擔憂。

sentences.en: The old man has served as the caretaker in the shopping center for ten years.
sentences.cn: 那位老人已經在這個購物中心作了十年管理員。

sentences.en: She was seen to come out of the flower shop, holding a carnation in her hand.
sentences.cn: 有人看到，她手裡拿著一支康乃馨，從那家花店出來。

sentences.en: A carnival atmosphere filled the shopping center.
sentences.cn: 這個購物中心充滿了狂歡節的氣氛。

sentences.en: She can always find something to carp about when living in the hotel.
sentences.cn: 住這間飯店的時候，她總是對某些事情吹毛求疵。

cn: v: 用盒包裝，製作紙箱

sentences.en: The little boy went to the store and bought a carton of milk.
sentences.cn: 那個小男孩走進那家商店，買了一盒牛奶。

sentences.en: The books they bought fell into five categories.
sentences.cn: 他們買的書可以分為五類。

sentences.en: The store is next to a cathedral church; you will not miss it.
sentences.cn: 這家商店在教區總教堂旁邊，你不會認錯的。

sentences.en: You should exercise with extreme caution when dealing with customers.
sentences.cn: 與顧客相處時，你要極為小心。

sentences.en: If I were you, I would be particularly cautious about spending money.
sentences.cn: 如果我是你，我用錢會格外謹慎。

sentences.en: Those celebrities of stage and screen always live a luxurious life.
sentences.cn: 那些舞臺和影視界名人總是生活奢侈。

sentences.en: The woman who sells celery has a carping tongue.
sentences.cn: 那個賣芹菜的婦人言語刻薄。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper kept a good cellar.
sentences.cn: 那位店主藏有大量的葡萄酒。

sentences.en: There is no need for you to buy that expensive cello.
sentences.cn: 你沒有必要買那把昂貴的大提琴。

sentences.en: The man came to the checkout with his ear glued to the cellphone.
sentences.cn: 那個人講著電話來到結帳處。

sentences.en: It's eight degrees below zero Celsius today, but there are so many people in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 今天是攝氏零下八度，然而，這家超市裡還是有這麼多人。

sentences.en: It's so cool in the mall, though it’s thirty-nine degrees centigrade today.
sentences.cn: 今天有攝氏三十九度，這家購物中心卻是如此涼爽。

sentences.en: You don't have to stand on ceremony with strangers in the crowded store.
sentences.cn: 在擁擠的商店裡，和陌生人不必拘禮。

sentences.en: You should have a medical certificate when buying medicine in the drugstore.
sentences.cn: 在這家藥房買藥，要持有醫療證明。

sentences.en: He took it upon himself to accompany the chairman to go shopping.
sentences.cn: 他擅自決定，陪董事長去購物。

sentences.en: It was a big change in lifestyle after she became the chairwoman and she didn't have time to go shopping.
sentences.cn: 她當選女議長之後，生活方式有了極大的變化，她都沒有時間去購物。

sentences.en: I just can't stand the salesman who always chants his own praises.
sentences.cn: 那個推銷員總是自誇，我實在無法忍受。

sentences.en: Please stop chattering on about your new necklace.
sentences.cn: 請停止談論你新買的項鍊吧。

sentences.en: He suddenly realized his checkbook was missing.
sentences.cn: 他突然意識到，自己的支票簿不見了。

cn: 報到，投宿登記手續，驗票並領取登機卡

sentences.en: There being nothing to be done, we have to wait at the check-in desk.
sentences.cn: 沒有辦法，我們只好在報到處等候。

sentences.en: I wonder what time check-out is.
sentences.cn: 我想知道退房的時間。

sentences.en: Her mother asked her to get a medical checkup before she went shopping.
sentences.cn: 她媽媽要她購物前先去做體檢。

sentences.en: If need be, you can ask the chef to buy some vegetables.
sentences.cn: 如果有必要，你可以讓廚師買一些蔬菜。

sentences.en: She went to buy some aspirin at the chemist's on her way home.
sentences.cn: 回家的路上，她去那家藥局買了些阿斯匹靈。

sentences.en: I feel a need to buy some roasted chestnuts.
sentences.cn: 我覺得有必要買一些炒栗子。

sentences.en: There is a great need for some chili peppers.
sentences.cn: 急需買一些辣椒。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper who looks like a chimpanzee is said to be of good descent.
sentences.cn: 據說，那個看起來像黑猩猩的店主出身很好。

sentences.en: The salesman joined in a church choir on impulse.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員一時衝動，就加入了教堂唱詩班。

sentences.en: The salesman seemed to have struck a chord with the old granny.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員似乎打動了那位老奶奶。

sentences.en: A little girl who was in a chubby sort of way asked her mother to buy a balloon just now.
sentences.cn: 剛才有個胖胖的小女孩要媽媽買氣球。

sentences.en: I think there may be a break in the circuit of the shop.
sentences.cn: 我想也許是商店裡的電路斷路。

sentences.en: The salesgirl cited the high total sales as evidence of the popularity of the computers.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員列舉龐大的銷售總額以證明這批電腦的流行。

sentences.en: A new supermarket will be built in civic centre next week.
sentences.cn: 下周，市中心將新建一家超市。

sentences.en: When I mentioned the new handbag she bought yesterday, she closed up like a clam.
sentences.cn: 我提起昨天她新買的手提包時，她閉口不言。

sentences.en: The sales manager always clammed up when asked about his clan.
sentences.cn: 被問及他的家族時，那位銷售經理總是閉口不言。

sentences.en: On seeing her in the supermarket, he went to her and held her hand in a firm clasp.
sentences.cn: 在超市裡一看到她，他就走過去，緊緊握著她的手。

sentences.en: There is a clause in the contract which says tenants should not sublease the flat to others.
sentences.cn: 合約條款規定，房客不得將公寓轉租給別人。

sentences.en: They clung to each other and said goodbye at the exit of the mall.
sentences.cn: 在購物中心的出口，他們相互擁抱告別。

sentences.en: She bought a bottle of juice and twisted the top in a clockwise direction.
sentences.cn: 她買了一瓶果汁，並按順時針方向轉開蓋子。

sentences.en: Surprisingly, he has been in clover since he bought that four-leaf clover.
sentences.cn: 奇怪的是，自從買了那株四葉草之後，他一直過著優裕的生活。

sentences.en: The girl bought a pot of rose and planted it in the garden, hoping there will be a cluster of roses next year.
sentences.cn: 那個女孩買了一盆玫瑰花，種在花園裡，希望明年可以有一簇玫瑰花。

sentences.en: That girl bought the lovely cat from the pet store and clutched it to her chest.
sentences.cn: 那個女孩從那家寵物店買了一隻可愛的貓咪，把牠緊緊抱在懷中。

cn: 海岸線，海岸地形（或輪廓）

sentences.en: On the painting she bought last week is the beautiful landscape along the rugged coastline.
sentences.cn: 她上周買的那幅畫上畫著崎嶇的海岸線附近的美麗風景。

cn: v: 成繭狀，把⋯緊緊包住

sentences.en: The baby was wrapped in a cocoon of blankets bought by his aunt.
sentences.cn: 那個嬰兒被包裹在姑姑買的毛毯中。

sentences.en: Please buy a coil of yarn for me when you come back from work.
sentences.cn: 下班回來的時候，請幫我買一卷毛線。

sentences.en: A colleague of hers just stared at the roses clustering round the window in the flower shop.
sentences.cn: 她的一位同事只是盯著花店窗戶裡四周叢生的玫瑰花。

sentences.en: You can imagine there being a pleasant surprise seeing the colonel in the clothing store.
sentences.cn: 可以想像，看到那位陸軍上校出現在這家服裝店中，人們是怎樣地驚喜。

cn: n: 殖民地居民，殖民時代建築

sentences.en: France, once a colonial power, now appears to be at the leading edge of fashion.
sentences.cn: 法國曾經是殖民強國，而今似乎走在了時尚尖端。

sentences.en: We must unite to combat with counterfeit and shoddy products.
sentences.cn: 我們必須團結起來，與假冒偽劣產品鬥爭。

cn: 喜劇演員，丑角，滑稽的人

sentences.en: She briefly clasped hands before saying goodbye to that comedian.
sentences.cn: 她與那位喜劇演員匆匆握手告別。

sentences.en: Seeing her brother clasp that salesgirl to his chest, she was greatly surprised, as if she had seen Halley's comet.
sentences.cn: 看到哥哥把那位女店員緊緊抱在懷中，她驚訝極了，像是看到了哈雷彗星。

sentences.en: The television commentator was seen to clasp a jade bracelet round her wrist.
sentences.cn: 有人看到，那位電視評論員將一個玉鐲戴在手腕上。

sentences.en: Her sister has received the commission to design dresses for the clothing store.
sentences.cn: 她姊姊已經接下委託，為那家服裝店設計洋裝。

sentences.en: As a salesman with poor salary, every penny is a precious commodity to him.
sentences.cn: 作為一個薪水少得可憐的推銷員，每一分錢對他而言都是很珍貴的。

sentences.en: I feel obliged to say that air travel is actually not at all exciting nowadays, just commonplace.
sentences.cn: 我不得不說，如今搭飛機旅行不足為奇，是件很平常的事。

sentences.en: You really need not have talked so much about communism ideals in the crowded grocery store.
sentences.cn: 在這擁擠的雜貨店裡，你真的不必談論那麼多的共產主義理想。

sentences.en: There is not any point in talking about communist ideology in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在超市裡，沒有任何必要談論共產主義意識形態。

sentences.en: They all agreed to commute the annuity into the lump sum.
sentences.cn: 他們都同意，將年金改為一次性總付款。

cn: 通勤者，經常乘公共車輛往返者

sentences.en: The six o'clock train is usually packed with commuters from Oxford to London.
sentences.cn: 六點的那列火車通常擠滿了從牛津到倫敦的通勤者。

sentences.en: No one knows why he insisted buying a compact mass of sand from that farmer.
sentences.cn: 沒有人知道，他為什麼堅持向那位農民買一堆堅實的沙子。

sentences.en: Why he shut down the store was beyond the compass of our mind.
sentences.cn: 我們想不通他為什麼關閉那個商店。

sentences.en: The owner of the hotel took compassion on her suffering and offered a room for her.
sentences.cn: 那位旅館主人同情她的遭遇，為她提供房間。

sentences.en: The old man was offered some food for free on compassionate grounds.
sentences.cn: 基於值得同情的理由，那位老人得到了些免費的食物。

sentences.en: We were compelled to change the price under the circumstances.
sentences.cn: 在這種情況下，我們不得不改變價格。

sentences.en: Your accompanying me to go shopping is a great compliment.
sentences.cn: 你能陪我去購物，太榮幸了。

sentences.en: She wants to buy some salt which is a compound of sodium and chlorine.
sentences.cn: 她想買鈉和氯的化合物—食鹽。

sentences.en: We cannot comprehend why he bought so much paper.
sentences.cn: 我們無法理解，他為什麼買這麼多紙張。

sentences.en: The salesgirl had no comprehension of what the old man wanted to buy.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員不明白，那位老人想買什麼。

sentences.en: The intermediary tried to get the seller and the buyer to reach a compromise.
sentences.cn: 那位調停者試圖讓買賣雙方和解。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper computed his losses in the fire at three thousand dollars.
sentences.cn: 那位店主估算，火災造成的損失可達三千美元。

cn: 使電腦化，引進電腦設備

sentences.en: There is a possibility of the factory's being fully computerized.
sentences.cn: 那家工廠實現全電腦化是有可能的。

sentences.en: He stood quietly seeing his army comrade work as a bodyguard, unable to comprehend.
sentences.cn: 他靜靜地站著，看著自己的戰友當了保鑣，實在無法理解。

sentences.en: The salesman tried his best to conceal his unemployment from his family.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員盡力隱瞞，不讓家人知道他已經失業。

sentences.en: We cannot conceive why he likes going to that store.
sentences.cn: 我們想不透他為什麼喜歡去那家商店。

sentences.en: The oil produced by the factory has been condemned as unfit for human consumption.
sentences.cn: 這家工廠生產的油已被宣佈不適合人們食用。

sentences.en: The foreigner asked an attendant of the hotel to conduct him to the door.
sentences.cn: 那位外國人要飯店的一位侍者領他去門口。

sentences.en: The young man made a full confession of his pilferage in the jewelry store.
sentences.cn: 對於在珠寶店行竊一事，那個年輕人供認不諱。

sentences.en: When confronted with the evidence of his pilferage in the store, the guy had to confess.
sentences.cn: 面對在商店行竊的證據，那人只得承認。

sentences.en: They finally consented to sell these shirts at a 10% discount.
sentences.cn: 他們最終同意，以九折出售這些襯衫。

sentences.en: We expect there to be a good way to conserve these strawberries.
sentences.cn: 我們期望，有好的辦法來保存這些草莓。

sentences.en: It is considerate of you to bring me a doggie bag.
sentences.cn: 你真是太體貼了，幫我拿了打包袋。

sentences.en: Nothing could console the old man whose purse was lost in the grocery store.
sentences.cn: 那位老人的錢包在雜貨店中遺失時，什麼都無法使他感到安慰。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper consoles himself with the thought that the new law is not constitutional.
sentences.cn: 那位店主聊以自慰地想，這項新法規不符合憲法。

sentences.en: Customers pay the salesgirl a very charming compliment on her contagious smile.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員的微笑富於感染力，顧客都極為讚賞。

sentences.en: Those salesmen always try to contaminate our minds with those lengthy speeches.
sentences.cn: 那些推銷員總是試圖用冗長的講話來污染我們的思想。

sentences.en: The man contemplated what his wife would say if he bought that theater.
sentences.cn: 那人在想，如果他買下那家劇院，妻子會怎麼說。

sentences.en: The man in the shop is contemporary with me.
sentences.cn: 在商店裡的那個人跟我是同時代的。

sentences.en: The businessman treats the small hotel with contempt it deserves.
sentences.cn: 那位商人對這家小旅館理所當然地嗤之以鼻。

sentences.en: I would contend that we should try to make both ends meet.
sentences.cn: 我認為，我們應該盡力使收支相抵。

sentences.en: The Englishman gave his consent for a continental lifestyle.
sentences.cn: 那個英國人同意採用大陸式的生活方式。

sentences.en: The middle-aged salesman's words lack continuity, always jumping from one subject to another.
sentences.cn: 那位中年推銷員說話缺乏連貫性，總是東拉西扯。

sentences.en: The house was converted from a storage room to a shop.
sentences.cn: 那個房子由儲物間改為商店。

sentences.en: There is not enough evidence to convict him of theft in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 沒有足夠的證據證明他在這家超市行竊。

sentences.en: The multinational corporation was sued for breach of copyright.
sentences.cn: 那家跨國公司因為侵犯版權而受到控告。

sentences.en: I can hardly understand her preference for necklaces made of coral.
sentences.cn: 我無法理解她對珊瑚項鍊的偏愛。

sentences.en: The trading corporation's bankruptcy was beyond comprehension.
sentences.cn: 那家貿易公司的破產令人無法理解。

sentences.en: There is a close correspondence between the customer's and the salesgirl’s words.
sentences.cn: 那位顧客與女店員的說法十分相似。

sentences.en: She cannot conceive that her purse was lost when walking along the corridor.
sentences.cn: 她無法相信經過走廊的時候，錢包就不見了。

sentences.en: She felt nothing but contempt for her husband who bought many expensive gifts for those corrupt officials.
sentences.cn: 她的丈夫買了很多昂貴的禮物送給那些腐敗的官員，她十分鄙視。

sentences.en: You had better listen to the counsel of your sister and limit your expenditure to what is essential.
sentences.cn: 你最好聽從姊姊的建議，把花費限制在必要的範圍內。

sentences.en: At the thought of the high price, the mean counselor doesn't want that suit.
sentences.cn: 一想到那昂貴的價格，那個吝嗇的顧問就不想買那套西裝。

sentences.en: The little boy twisted the top of the bottle in a counterclockwise direction.
sentences.cn: 那個小男孩按照逆時針方向轉瓶塞。

sentences.en: It was just at that moment that the shopkeeper conceived the notion of money-off coupons.
sentences.cn: 正是在那時候，這位店主想到了優惠券的主意。

sentences.en: Her mother contemplated buying some flowers to decorate the cobbled courtyard.
sentences.cn: 她媽媽在考慮，買些花裝點這個鋪著鵝卵石的庭院。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper was condemned as cowardly.
sentences.cn: 那位店主因膽小怯懦而被指責。

cn: a: 溫暖而舒適的，安逸的

sentences.en: At the idea of buying a nice cozy little house, she was quite exciting.
sentences.cn: 一想到要買間美妙舒適的小屋子，她就很激動。

sentences.en: Out of compassion for the poor beggar, she bought a box of crackers for him.
sentences.cn: 出於對那個可憐的乞丐的同情，她買了一盒薄脆餅乾給他。

sentences.en: There appears to be a bomb crater in the small village.
sentences.cn: 這個小村莊裡似乎有個彈坑。

cn: v: 發出輾軋聲，嘎吱作響

sentences.en: With the creak of the door, a little child entered the small store.
sentences.cn: 隨著門的吱嘎聲，一個小孩子走進這家小商店。

sentences.en: If we could not find a good way to sell these fruits, we would be up the creek.
sentences.cn: 如果我們不能找到辦法出售這些水果，我們將會陷入困境。

sentences.en: It's hardly conceivable to her that the couple even could not afford the crib.
sentences.cn: 她幾乎無法相信，那對夫婦連嬰兒床都買不起。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper shed crocodile tears when he drove away that poor beggar.
sentences.cn: 驅趕那個可憐的乞丐離開時，那位店主假裝哭泣。

sentences.en: The old man who was knocked down by a car at the crossing aroused the rich man's compassion.
sentences.cn: 在十字路口被車撞到的那位老人，引起了有錢男子的同情。

cn: v: 屈膝，蹲伏，卑躬屈膝

sentences.en: I have no idea why the girl suddenly drops down into a crouch.
sentences.cn: 我不知道那個女孩為什麼突然蹲下去。

sentences.en: If it comes to the crunch, you can take the emergency exit in the mall.
sentences.cn: 關鍵的時候，你可以走購物中心的緊急通道。

sentences.en: She hopes to hear compliment on the crystal necklace she bought yesterday.
sentences.cn: 她希望聽到別人讚美她昨天買的水晶項鍊。

sentences.en: They were disappointed at there being no restaurant with excellent cuisine.
sentences.cn: 這裡沒有什麼菜餚精緻的餐廳，他們感到失望。

sentences.en: You must put a curb on your spending.
sentences.cn: 你必須限制開支。

sentences.en: If you contemplate a visit to a foreign country, you should prepare some cash in local currency.
sentences.cn: 如果你想去國外旅遊，要準備些當地貨幣。

sentences.en: She can understand the French guest because French was on the curriculum in college.
sentences.cn: 上大學的時候有法語課，所以她可以聽懂那個法國客人的話。

sentences.en: You really don't have to curry favor with those wealthy guests.
sentences.cn: 你真的不必討好那些富有的客人。

sentences.en: As for those articles for exportation, you have to pay customs on them.
sentences.cn: 對於那些出口商品，要繳納關稅。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper rang off and made a dart for the storage room.
sentences.cn: 那位店主掛斷電話，衝向儲物間。

cn: 使眼花，使傾倒 n耀眼的光，令人讚歎的東西

sentences.en: The little girl was dazzled by the colorful lights in the mall.
sentences.cn: 購物中心裡的彩燈照得那個小女孩目眩。

sentences.en: She bought many sweets in complete contempt of danger of tooth decay.
sentences.cn: 她買了很多糖果，完全不顧蛀牙的危害。

sentences.en: The old man was deceived into believing that the drug can cure his disease.
sentences.cn: 那位老人受騙，以為這種藥可以治癒他的疾病。

sentences.en: At the bare idea of the declaration of income, the manager was deeply upset.
sentences.cn: 一想到收益申報表，那位經理極為沮喪。

sentences.en: She was delegated to be in charge of the sales department.
sentences.cn: 她被委派監管銷售部。

sentences.en: The delegation worked out a compromise agreement and decided to stay at the hotel for three days.
sentences.cn: 代表團制定出妥協方案，決定在這家旅館停留三日。

sentences.en: The democrat contributed five thousand dollars to a charity collection.
sentences.cn: 那位民主人士向慈善事業捐贈五千美元。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper's repeated denial of the promised discount drove her out of her mind.
sentences.cn: 那位店主一再否認曾經許諾過的折扣，使得她失去了理智。

sentences.en: The owner of the restaurant was filled with compassion by the beggar's descriptive account of his suffering.
sentences.cn: 那個乞丐對其遭遇的描述，使得那位餐廳老闆充滿同情。

sentences.en: The sale of those shoes has been the despair of the sales manager.
sentences.cn: 在那位銷售經理看來，出售那些鞋子是毫無希望的。

sentences.en: The salesman was often despised for his meanness.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員總是因為吝嗇而受人鄙視。

sentences.en: Those travelers failed to comprehend the seriousness of the choice of their destination.
sentences.cn: 那些旅行者沒有理解目的地選擇的重要性。

sentences.en: Maybe it's her destiny to work as a sales assistant.
sentences.cn: 也許當個銷售助理，是她的命運。

sentences.en: The destructive fire drove the owner of the grocery store to despair.
sentences.cn: 那場毀滅性的大火使這位雜貨店主陷入絕望。

sentences.en: Being a solider requires a good comprehension of devotion to duty.
sentences.cn: 作為軍人，要充分理解忠於職守的意義。

cn: 吞食，毀滅，全神貫注地看

sentences.en: Flames devoured a huge area of the buildings in the commercial district.
sentences.cn: 火焰吞沒了商業區的大片建築物。

sentences.en: There ought not to be dialect for the shopping guide in the mall.
sentences.cn: 這家購物中心不允許導購說方言。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper darted a look of disbelief at that guy.
sentences.cn: 這位店主不相信地瞥了男人一眼。

sentences.en: The clerk had to discard all thought of buying fashionable clothes.
sentences.cn: 那個職員只得放棄買時裝的想法。

sentences.en: The customer there is an ardent disciple of Gandhi.
sentences.cn: 那邊那個顧客是甘地的忠實信徒。

sentences.en: High-quality discriminated the cars produced by the factory from others of the same kind.
sentences.cn: 品質優異使得這家工廠生產的汽車與同類的其他車輛明顯不同。

sentences.en: He could dispense with the medicine, so you needn't buy for him.
sentences.cn: 他不必再吃這款藥，所以你不需要給他買了。

sentences.en: There is no choice but to dispose of the furniture at a low price.
sentences.cn: 別無選擇，只得低價出售這些傢俱。

sentences.en: The salesman drew a distinction between the rich and the poor in the area.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員對這個地區的富人和窮人加以區別。

sentences.en: Excellent cuisine should be distinctive of the restaurant.
sentences.cn: 菜餚精緻應該是這家餐廳的特色。

sentences.en: The loss caused in the robbery was a great distress to the shopkeeper.
sentences.cn: 在此次搶劫中所蒙受的損失使那位店主極為難過。

sentences.en: She typed a shopping list on the computer, but she forgot to save the document.
sentences.cn: 她在電腦上列了一張購物清單，卻忘記存檔。

sentences.en: Seeing a group of foreigners turning up on the doorstep, the man was extremely excited.
sentences.cn: 看到一群外國人出現在門口，那位男人極為興奮。

sentences.en: The owner of the restaurant darted an angry look at the beggar standing in the doorway.
sentences.cn: 那位餐廳老闆狠狠地看了站在門口的那個乞丐一眼。

sentences.en: He saw the baker knead the dough on a floured board and then leave it to rise.
sentences.cn: 他看到那位麵包師在沾滿麵粉的案板上揉麵糰，然後等它發酵。

sentences.en: There is said to be a downward trend in price.
sentences.cn: 據說，價格出現下滑的趨勢。

sentences.en: She was forced to sell the jade bracelet which was handed downwards from generation to generation.
sentences.cn: 她被迫出售那個世代相傳的玉鐲。

sentences.en: The little girl draped her arms round her mother's neck and asked her to buy that doll.
sentences.cn: 那個女孩伸著手臂抱著媽媽的脖子，要她買那個洋娃娃。

sentences.en: There might be a dreadful mistake; it was not she who bought that bracelet.
sentences.cn: 也許是大錯特錯了，她並沒有買那個手鐲。

sentences.en: There is likely to be a downward trend in the price of the dresser.
sentences.cn: 這個梳粧台可能會降價。

sentences.en: There is nothing for it but to replace curry powder with salad dressing.
sentences.cn: 別無他法，只得用沙拉調味料來代替咖喱粉。

sentences.en: We want there to be no snow on the driveway tomorrow so that we can go shopping.
sentences.cn: 我們希望明天車道上不會有積雪，那麼我們就可以去購物了。

sentences.en: They signed a sales contract of two years' duration with that clothing store.
sentences.cn: 他們與那家服裝店簽訂為期兩年的銷售合約。

sentences.en: As dusk falls, she finally comes out of the jewelry store.
sentences.cn: 黃昏來臨時，她終於從那家珠寶店走了出來。

cn: v: 使受阻礙，使相形見絀

sentences.en: At the bare thought of Snow White and the Seven Dwarves, the schoolgirl went into that bookstore.
sentences.cn: 一想起《白雪公主和七個小矮人》，那個女學生走進那家書店。

sentences.en: There is no guessing what the salesman dwells on.
sentences.cn: 猜不到那位推銷員在想些什麼。

sentences.en: The clerk who lives in a portable dwelling dreamed of there being enough money to buy an apartment.
sentences.cn: 那個職員住在活動房屋中，夢想能有足夠的錢買一處公寓。

sentences.en: The brand of laptops remained in eclipse during the past ten years.
sentences.cn: 在過去的十年中，這種品牌的筆記型電腦默默無名。

sentences.en: Delicious jellied eels of the restaurant dwelt in his mind.
sentences.cn: 這家餐館鮮美的鰻魚凍停留在他的記憶裡。

sentences.en: Being unable to buy an apartment made quite a dent in the young man's ego.
sentences.cn: 買不起公寓，這大大地打擊了那個年輕人的自尊。

sentences.en: There is nothing more exciting than an elaborate meal.
sentences.cn: 沒有什麼比一頓精心製作的餐點更振奮人心的了。

sentences.en: The teacher bought many books, hoping to elevate the minds of her students.
sentences.cn: 那位教師買了很多書，希望提高學生的素養。

sentences.en: Seeing his girlfriend in the mall, he went over and held her in a warm embrace.
sentences.cn: 在購物中心看到女朋友，他走過去並熱情地擁抱她。

sentences.en: Please make every endeavor to sell these bananas.
sentences.cn: 請盡力出售這些香蕉。

sentences.en: The couple wanted to enroll their child in an elite school at any cost.
sentences.cn: 這對夫婦希望讓孩子進入精英學校，為此不惜一切代價。

sentences.en: She went to buy some sleeping pills to ensure herself a good night's sleep.
sentences.cn: 為了確保自己能睡個好覺，她去買了些安眠藥。

sentences.en: The trading company has become one of the most successful enterprises of its kind.
sentences.cn: 這家貿易公司已經成為同類企業中的佼佼者。

sentences.en: The lady seems to be quite enthusiastic about buying fashionable clothes.
sentences.cn: 那位女士似乎極為熱衷於購買時髦衣物。

cn: 為書取名，給⋯權力或資格

sentences.en: The bearer of the coupon shall be entitled to a thirty percent savings.
sentences.cn: 這張優惠券的持有人可以享受百分之三十的優惠。

sentences.en: There is a tendency in youths to equate the luxurious lifestyle to happiness.
sentences.cn: 年輕人似乎傾向把奢侈的生活等同於幸福。

sentences.en: Why they decided to spend two thousand dollars erecting a statue in the square was beyond our comprehension.
sentences.cn: 他們為什麼決定花兩千美元在廣場上修建雕像，我們無法理解。

sentences.en: When her husband noticed the size of the bill, he erupted with anger.
sentences.cn: 看到巨額帳單時，她的丈夫勃然大怒。

sentences.en: The lady went to the trade fair under the escort of two bodyguards.
sentences.cn: 在兩名保鑣的陪同下，那位夫人去了商品展覽會。

sentences.en: He was most distressed to realize that he cannot buy an estate for his daughter.
sentences.cn: 意識到自己無力為女兒購置房產，他十分難過。

sentences.en: The old man who bought many foods to these poor children was held in great esteem.
sentences.cn: 那位老人為這些可憐的孩子買了很多食物，人們都非常尊敬他。

cn: 永恆的，永久的，無休止的

sentences.en: Her husband condemned her for her eternal chatter about shopping.
sentences.cn: 她的丈夫指責她喋喋不休地談論購物。

cn: 倫理學，道德規範，行為準則

sentences.en: The business ethics seems to be on the downward path.
sentences.cn: 商業道德似乎是在走下坡路。

cn: a: 常綠的，永保青春的

sentences.en: Tom came home in the dusk of the evening with the evergreen shrubs he bought.
sentences.cn: 黃昏時，湯姆帶著他買的常綠灌木回到家。

sentences.en: It would be an exaggeration to say that he has never been to the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 要說他從來都沒有去過超市，那是誇張的說法。

sentences.en: It's no exaggeration to say that the price of the desk will not exceed fifty dollars.
sentences.cn: 毫不誇張地說，這張桌子的價格不會超過五十美元。

sentences.en: Her mother excels at bargaining with street vendors.
sentences.cn: 她的媽媽擅長與街頭小販討價還價。

sentences.en: The furniture in the store is only sold at a low price in exceptional circumstances.
sentences.cn: 只有在特殊情況下，這家商店裡的傢俱才會以低價出售。

sentences.en: The granny complained that she was charged an excess of five dollars over the amount on the bill.
sentences.cn: 那位老奶奶抱怨說，與帳單上的數目相比，她多付了五美元。

sentences.en: He exclaimed that the computer's price was unreasonable.
sentences.cn: 他叫著說，這台電腦的價格不合理。

sentences.en: We cannot exclude the possibility that watermelons may be in excess of demand.
sentences.cn: 我們不能排除這樣的可能性，西瓜可能會供過於求。

sentences.en: The local government will execute a plan to reduce fuel consumption.
sentences.cn: 當地政府將執行一項計畫，來減少燃料消耗。

sentences.en: The sales executive in the mall possesses excellent executive ability.
sentences.cn: 這家購物中心的行銷主任具有傑出的管理才能。

sentences.en: After an exile of eight years, her brother returned home and bought many gifts for the family.
sentences.cn: 背井離鄉八年之後，她哥哥返家並買了很多禮物給家人。

sentences.en: The young man has got an extension to pay the bill.
sentences.cn: 那個年輕人獲准延期支付帳單。

sentences.en: The owner of the restaurant plans to carry out extensive repair work next month.
sentences.cn: 那個餐廳老闆打算在下個月著手進行大規模的擴建工程。

sentences.en: The gentle man with a rough exterior bought some food for the beggar.
sentences.cn: 那個外貌粗獷、性情溫和的男人為那個乞丐買了些食物。

sentences.en: As a supervisor, it's unwise to judge people by externals only.
sentences.cn: 作為一名主管，以貌取人是不明智的。

sentences.en: You can rely on there being fine weather tomorrow so that you can pay a visit to the extinct volcano.
sentences.cn: 你可以指望明天天氣好，那麼你就可以去看那座死火山了。

sentences.en: There could have been a plentiful supply of watermelons but for the extraordinary weather.
sentences.cn: 要不是這反常的天氣，本該有充足的西瓜供應。

sentences.en: She fluttered her eyelashes at her husband, hoping he would buy the necklace for her.
sentences.cn: 她對丈夫眨眼示意，希望他為她買下這串項鍊。

sentences.en: She bought that expensive handbag without batting an eyelid.
sentences.cn: 她面不改色地買下那個昂貴的手提包。

sentences.en: The textile fabric's price exceeded all expectations.
sentences.cn: 那些紡織品的價格超出所有人的預期。

sentences.en: There has been a fad for wearing blue shawls these days.
sentences.cn: 這段時間藍色的披肩很流行。

cn: a: 華氏的，華氏溫度計的
n: 華氏溫度計，華氏溫標

sentences.en: It has been 102 degrees Fahrenheit for a few days, so the air-conditioners sell well.
sentences.cn: 這些天氣溫都是華氏一○二度，所以冷氣很暢銷。

sentences.en: The guy showed no sign of faltering when caught stealing in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在超市行竊被抓，那人卻毫不畏縮。

sentences.en: His daughter seems to be fascinated with the doll in the shop window.
sentences.cn: 他的女兒似乎被商店櫥窗裡的玩偶吸引。

sentences.en: The young man has been fatigued with overtime work because he wanted to buy an apartment.
sentences.cn: 那個年輕人想買一棟公寓，所以總是因為加班工作而感到疲乏。

sentences.en: The store had received an order for office appliances from the federal agency.
sentences.cn: 那家商店收到了那個聯邦機構購買辦公用品的訂單。

sentences.en: She made a feeble attempt to explain the size of the bill.
sentences.cn: 她徒勞地試圖解釋那巨額的帳單。

sentences.en: Handbags should be quite necessary from a feminine point of view.
sentences.cn: 從女性立場來看，手提包是十分必要的。

sentences.en: There is expected to be no artificial fertilizer anymore.
sentences.cn: 希望不會再有假肥料。

sentences.en: The girl in red dress is my fiancée.
sentences.cn: 那個穿紅色洋裝的女生是我的未婚妻。

sentences.en: The man of fine fiber bought many books in the bookstore.
sentences.cn: 那個性情文雅的人在這家書店裡買了很多書。

sentences.en: The little boy fiddles about with the alarm clock his father bought for him yesterday.
sentences.cn: 那個小男孩在胡亂撥弄爸爸昨天給他買的鬧鐘。

sentences.en: It does not take long to filter coffee with this coffee filter her son bought the other day.
sentences.cn: 用她兒子前幾天買的這個咖啡濾紙過濾咖啡，不會花費太多時間。

sentences.en: I'm glad we have come to an agreement about the price; tip me your fin.
sentences.cn: 很高興，我們就價格議題達成一致，我們握個手吧。

sentences.en: They changed their dwelling to engage in inshore fishery.
sentences.cn: 他們搬家以從事近海漁業。

sentences.en: When he got home, he flaked out in the sofa, since he wandered in the mall the whole day.
sentences.cn: 他在購物中心逛了一整天，所以回到家就癱倒在沙發上。

sentences.en: The little girl was in a flap when she went lost in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在超市中迷路時，那個小女孩忐忑不安。

sentences.en: His explanation for the contract was full of flaws.
sentences.cn: 他對於那合約的解釋是漏洞百出的。

sentences.en: The cat's tail flicked from side to side, as if it were asking me to buy that ball of wool.
sentences.cn: 那隻貓來回搖著尾巴，似乎是要我買那個毛線團。

sentences.en: When he was told the mobile phone had been sold out after waiting in the line for three hours, he flipped his lid.
sentences.cn: 排隊等了三個小時後，卻被告知手機已經售完，他氣得發狂。

sentences.en: To my knowledge, this species of flower you bought flourishes in a cool climate.
sentences.cn: 就我所知，你買的那種花在涼爽的氣候中會茁壯生長。

sentences.en: The salesgirl built up a fluency in spoken English after working here for three years.
sentences.cn: 在這裡工作三年之後，那位女店員練就了流利的英語口說。

sentences.en: She met her bitter foe who had no fiber in the mall.
sentences.cn: 她在購物中心遇到那個缺乏人格的死敵。

sentences.en: The deceiver was foiled in his attempt to rip us off.
sentences.cn: 那個騙子企圖騙我們的錢，卻沒有成功。

sentences.en: The storybook she bought was adapted from a French folklore.
sentences.cn: 她買的那本故事書是根據法國民間傳說改寫的。

sentences.en: In order to work out the marketing plan, the manager was always forgetful of his sleep and meals.
sentences.cn: 為了制定行銷計畫，那位經理總是廢寢忘食。

cn: 格式 v使格式化，安排⋯的格局

sentences.en: The novel she bought was a reissued version in a new format.
sentences.cn: 她買的那本小說是以新格式重新發行的版本。

sentences.en: She was determined to buy that apartment, by fair means or foul.
sentences.cn: 她決定買下那棟公寓，哪怕是不擇手段。

sentences.en: There would be a plentiful supply of fowl if there are no more foul-ups.
sentences.cn: 如果不再出差錯，會有充足的禽肉供應。

sentences.en: She decided to buy that bracelet after hesitating for the merest fraction of a second.
sentences.cn: 猶豫了一秒鐘之後，她決定買下那個手鐲。

sentences.en: They plan to explore the new commodity approach within the existing framework of practice.
sentences.cn: 他們打算，在現有慣例模式的框架結構中，尋找新的商品模式。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper was frantic with worry about the sales of watermelons.
sentences.cn: 那位店主為那些西瓜的銷售而發愁。

sentences.en: The ship freighted with cars stopped within a fraction of a meter of the dock.
sentences.cn: 那艘裝載著汽車的船在離碼頭一公尺不到的地方停住。

sentences.en: The man was frantic to head for the frontier town to buy tobacco.
sentences.cn: 那人十萬火急地趕往那個邊疆城鎮去買菸草。

sentences.en: She was fuming with rage at the spots of mud on her new dress.
sentences.cn: 她的新洋裝沾上泥汙，她氣得發狂。

sentences.en: She was speechless with fury when her brother wanted to rip her off.
sentences.cn: 她的哥哥想騙她的錢，她氣得說不出話來。

sentences.en: The sales manager is said to be on a short fuse.
sentences.cn: 據說，那位銷售經理脾氣暴躁。

sentences.en: There was a real fuss when the boy was caught stealing in the grocery store.
sentences.cn: 那個男孩在雜貨店行竊被抓，真夠他受的。

sentences.en: Tom gallops ahead of others in the sale of computers.
sentences.cn: 湯姆的電腦銷售量遠遠超過了其他人。

sentences.en: The new garment served as the perfect foil for the lady's fine complexion.
sentences.cn: 那件新衣服襯得那位女士容顏姣好。

sentences.en: The young man gasped in astonishment at the price of the apartment.
sentences.cn: 那棟公寓的價格驚得那個年輕人倒抽一口氣。

sentences.en: The salesman made a fuss of methods of information gathering.
sentences.cn: 那位推銷員過於在意資訊收集的方法。

sentences.en: It's unwise to spend money with gay abandon.
sentences.cn: 揮霍錢財是不明智的。

sentences.en: The users of the mascara make no distinction between the male and female genders.
sentences.cn: 這款睫毛膏同樣適用於男性和女性。

sentences.en: There is a fractional difference in the price of the grapes subjected to the geographical distribution.
sentences.cn: 受地域分佈的限制，葡萄的價格有些許的差別。

sentences.en: The schoolboy was gasping for the geometry set in the store.
sentences.cn: 那個學童想要那家商店裡的幾何學繪圖器。

sentences.en: By way of introduction, the salesgirl gave her the background to the book about glacier plains.
sentences.cn: 作為介紹，那個女店員向她說明了這本關於冰川平原的書的寫作背景。

sentences.en: When accused of stealing in the store, he just glared silently at the shopkeeper.
sentences.cn: 被指責在店中行竊時，他只是沉默地盯著那位店主。

cn: 微光 v（使）閃爍，（使）閃亮

sentences.en: I don't know how to make the ball I bought gleam.
sentences.cn: 我不知道如何讓我買的那個球發光。

sentences.en: She cannot disguise her glee at the new mobile phone her father bought for her.
sentences.cn: 爸爸買新手機給她，她不禁喜形於色。

sentences.en: She was in high glee to buy that ring glittering with diamonds.
sentences.cn: 她滿心歡喜地買下那枚閃閃生輝的鑽戒。

sentences.en: She remained sunken in gloom for a week because her boyfriend did not buy gifts for her at Christmas.
sentences.cn: 耶誕節時，男朋友沒有給她買禮物，她沮喪了一周。

sentences.en: Fear and anxiety gnawed at his heart after he stole the ring from the store.
sentences.cn: 從那家店中偷了那枚戒指之後，他心中恐懼不安。

cn: v: 大口猛吃，咯咯地叫

sentences.en: The boy bought a hamburger in the store and gobbled it down in a hurry.
sentences.cn: 那個男孩在這家商店買了個漢堡，並匆匆忙忙地吞了下去。

sentences.en: The sight of robbery in the store made his gorge rise.
sentences.cn: 看到這家店裡發生搶劫案，他十分氣憤。

cn: 絢麗的，美麗動人的，令人愉快的

sentences.en: She feels like going shopping in such a gorgeous weather.
sentences.cn: 天氣如此美好，她想去購物。

sentences.en: The gorilla with a dangerous gleam in his eyes came to buy a knife.
sentences.cn: 那個眼露凶光的惡漢來買了一把刀。

sentences.en: You can take it as absolute gospel that the furniture in the mall is sold at a fifty percent discount.
sentences.cn: 這家購物中心的傢俱五折優惠，這是千真萬確的。

sentences.en: Her grandpa granted his permission to buy that cat.
sentences.cn: 她的爺爺同意買那隻貓。

cn: 重力，萬有引力，地心引力，嚴肅，重要

sentences.en: The governments fail to realize the gravity of the fact that so many people rush to buy salt in large amounts.
sentences.cn: 這麼多人急著大量購買食鹽，政府卻沒有意識到這個事實的重要性。

sentences.en: The little boy grazed his leg against the stair in the shopping center.
sentences.cn: 那個小男孩在這個購物中心的臺階上擦傷了腿。

sentences.en: The actress made a fuss about the price of grease paint.
sentences.cn: 那位女演員抱怨說，化妝油彩價格太高。

sentences.en: The thief stared at the jewelry in the shop window and consumed with greed and envy.
sentences.cn: 那個滿心貪婪與嫉妒的小偷盯著商店櫥窗裡的珠寶。

sentences.en: The salesman tried to persuade her into buying the shampoo like grim death.
sentences.cn: 那個推銷員堅持不懈地勸說她買那款洗髮精。

sentences.en: The old man who was in the grip of despair bought a bottle of sleeping pills.
sentences.cn: 那位陷入絕望的老人買了一瓶安眠藥。

sentences.en: The housewife was always groaning on about how much money she had to spend on meals.
sentences.cn: 那位家庭主婦總是抱怨，她要為一日三餐花費那麼多錢。

cn: a: 顯而易見的，總的，惡劣的

sentences.en: In the gross, the apples in the store are sold by kilogram.
sentences.cn: 一般而言，這家商店裡的蘋果是按公斤出售的。

sentences.en: When they entered the pet store, a little dog growled at them.
sentences.cn: 他們走進那家寵物店的時候，一隻小狗對他們狂叫。

sentences.en: The customer kept grumbling at being charged an excess of two dollars.
sentences.cn: 那位顧客一直抱怨說他被多收兩美元。

sentences.en: You can choose books freely in the bookstore within certain broad guidelines.
sentences.cn: 在這家書店，你可以在某些廣泛的準則範圍之內自由選擇書籍。

sentences.en: The little boy sobbed with loud gulps because his mother did not buy him that toy.
sentences.cn: 媽媽沒有買那個玩具給他，所以那個小男孩大聲抽泣。

cn: n: 一陣狂風，（感情）迸發

sentences.en: The man felt a gust of anger when he found he bought a counterfeit painting.
sentences.cn: 發現自己買了一幅假畫，那人很氣憤。

sentences.en: The timid girl does not have the guts to buy flowers in the store around the corner.
sentences.cn: 那個膽小的女孩不敢去附近的那家店裡買花。

cn: n: 吉普賽人，吉普賽語

sentences.en: The gypsy bought a cup of coffee and emptied it at one gallop.
sentences.cn: 那個吉普賽人買了一杯咖啡並一口氣喝完。

sentences.en: She bought a novel which was hailed as a masterpiece.
sentences.cn: 她買了一本被譽為傑作的小說。

sentences.en: She grumbled at the barber about her new hairstyle.
sentences.cn: 她對理髮師抱怨她的新髮型。

sentences.en: Not having a car seems to be a serious handicap in the country.
sentences.cn: 在這個國家，沒有車似乎是極為不利。

sentences.en: The young man looked at those traditional handicrafts in the shop window.
sentences.cn: 那個年輕人看著商店櫥窗裡的那些傳統手工藝品。

sentences.en: We grant the truth of what you say; the hardy man never buys down jackets in winter.
sentences.cn: 我們承認你所言屬實，那個強健的人冬天從來都不買羽絨服。

sentences.en: His father came home with the harness he bought in the gathering gloom.
sentences.cn: 天愈來愈暗的時候，他爸爸帶著買來的馬具回到家。

sentences.en: The boy was hauled over the coals for breaking the vase his mother bought.
sentences.cn: 那個男孩打破了媽媽買的花瓶，因此受到嚴厲斥責。

sentences.en: The businessman plans to revisit the haunts of his youth.
sentences.cn: 那個商人打算重遊年輕時的舊地。

sentences.en: She gave her hearty approval and support to her husband's proposal to buy an apartment.
sentences.cn: 丈夫提議買一棟公寓，她對此竭誠贊同支持。

cn: 天空的，非常合意的，令人愉快的

sentences.en: The bakery with heavenly cakes should be a favorite haunt of kids.
sentences.cn: 這家麵包店有美味的蛋糕，是孩子們常去的地方。

sentences.en: In wartime many people bought gold as a hedge against inflation.
sentences.cn: 在征戰時期，很多人都購買黃金，以防通貨膨脹。

sentences.en: The millionaire paid no heed to the price of the latest laptop.
sentences.cn: 那位百萬富翁並不在意這台最新款筆記型電腦的價格。

sentences.en: Those unsalable peaches heightened the shopkeeper's anxiety.
sentences.cn: 那些滯銷的桃子加重了這位店主的憂慮。

sentences.en: The young man who bought a large estate in the country was said to be heir of a large fortune.
sentences.cn: 據說，那個在鄉下買大量地產的年輕人是大筆財產的繼承人。

sentences.en: The price of petrol has been on the increase, hence the need for more money.
sentences.cn: 汽油價格已經上漲，所以需要更多的錢。

sentences.en: Forthcoming summer should be the herald of the watermelon season.
sentences.cn: 即將到來的夏天預示著西瓜旺季的到來。

sentences.en: They faced with the grim prospect of large profits in kitchen herbs.
sentences.cn: 要想從調味用草本香料中獲取高額利潤，前景黯淡。

sentences.en: He saw little prospect of buying sweet herbs from the hermit.
sentences.cn: 他覺得，向那位隱士購買甜香草是沒有什麼希望的。

sentences.en: Seeing the book about heroic myths in the bookstore, the schoolgirl's eyes gleamed with excitement.
sentences.cn: 在書店看到那本關於英雄故事的書，那個女學生眼中散發出激動的神情。

sentences.en: The girl has a good grip of heterosexual intimacy.
sentences.cn: 那個女孩十分理解異性之間的親密。

sentences.en: I don't want to hear another grumble from you about the hi-fi records.
sentences.cn: 我不想再聽你抱怨那些高傳真的唱片。

sentences.en: Their plane was hijacked when they were on a visit to Canada.
sentences.cn: 他們搭飛機去加拿大的時候，遭遇了劫機事件。

sentences.en: The audience greeted the drama with boos and hisses.
sentences.cn: 觀眾對這齣戲劇發出噓聲。

sentences.en: The teacher's voice was as hoarse as a raven after talking with the student for an hour.
sentences.cn: 與那名學生談了一小時之後，這位老師的嗓音沙啞。

sentences.en: The man kicked up a fuss about the price of the hockey stick.
sentences.cn: 那人對這柄曲棍球杆的價格強烈不滿。

sentences.en: The old priest gave a glacial stare at the two homosexuals.
sentences.cn: 那位老神父冷冷地盯著那兩個同性戀者。

cn: n: 汽車喇叭聲，雁叫聲

sentences.en: When they entered the supermarket, he still did not stop fussing about the terrible honk of their car.
sentences.cn: 走進超市的時候，他仍然沒有停止抱怨車的喇叭聲。

sentences.en: Weather permitting; we can drive the car with the hood down tomorrow to go shopping.
sentences.cn: 如果天氣好的話，明天我們可以敞著車篷開車去購物。

sentences.en: The butcher full of grumbles went to buy a cattle on the hoof and slaughtered it.
sentences.cn: 那個滿腹牢騷的屠夫去買頭活牛然後宰殺。

sentences.en: The salesgirl was told bottles of wine should be kept horizontal.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員被告知，葡萄酒瓶應當平放。

sentences.en: The robber took a little child hostage in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 那個搶劫犯在超市裡挾持一名小孩子作為人質。

sentences.en: Most customers were hostile towards the price increase of daily necessities.
sentences.cn: 很多顧客都反對日用品價格上漲。

sentences.en: The middle-aged man was hounded out of the supermarket by the guard.
sentences.cn: 那個中年人被保全趕出超市。

sentences.en: The new couple who are on a tight budget cannot afford to change the poor housing conditions.
sentences.cn: 那對新婚夫婦生活拮据，無力改變惡劣的居住條件。

sentences.en: Seeing her husband buy a bracelet for her, a smile hovered on her lips.
sentences.cn: 看到丈夫為她買了個手鐲，她露出笑容。

sentences.en: The price increase in daily necessities caused howls of protest from the customers.
sentences.cn: 日用品價格上漲引起顧客的抗議呼聲。

sentences.en: He hurled insults at the boy who was caught stealing.
sentences.cn: 他厲聲辱罵那個行竊被抓的男孩。

sentences.en: There is little prospect of his buying a hymn book.
sentences.cn: 他不可能去買一本讚美詩集。

sentences.en: What an idiot he was to be charged an excess of thirty dollars over the amount on the bill.
sentences.cn: 他真笨，與帳單上的數額相比，居然多付了三十美元。

sentences.en: There are immense possibilities of buying these materials at a low price.
sentences.cn: 以低價購買這些材料，是很有可能的。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper dealt with the unreasonably troublesome customer with imperial generosity.
sentences.cn: 對於那位無理取鬧的顧客，這位店主寬宏大量地應對。

sentences.en: The local government decided to impose a further tax on luxuries.
sentences.cn: 當地政府決定對奢侈品進一步徵稅。

sentences.en: Women always felt an irresistible impulse to buy fashionable clothes.
sentences.cn: 女性總是有種無法抑制的衝動去購買時裝。

sentences.en: The young man felt deeply incensed by the girl's indifference.
sentences.cn: 那個女孩的冷淡讓這個年輕人感到十分憤怒。

sentences.en: The increasing sale of luxuries could be regarded as an index of the town's prosperity.
sentences.cn: 奢侈品銷售量日漸增長可以視為這個城鎮經濟繁榮的標誌。

sentences.en: It's a matter of complete indifference to me whether you buy that handbag.
sentences.cn: 你買不買那個手提包，對我而言，都完全無所謂。

sentences.en: The businessman seems to be indifferent to the price increase in luxury goods.
sentences.cn: 奢侈品價格上漲，對此那位商人似乎並不關心。

sentences.en: Many housewives are indignant at the price increase in daily necessities.
sentences.cn: 日用品價格上漲，很多家庭主婦都感到憤慨。

sentences.en: Computers seem to have become an indispensable part of our life nowadays.
sentences.cn: 如今，電腦似乎成為我們的生活中必不可少的一部分。

sentences.en: The salesgirl tried to induce the old man to buy the walking stick.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員試圖勸說那位老人買那根手杖。

sentences.en: The clerk plans to indulge himself with a bottle of champagne in the pub.
sentences.cn: 那位職員打算去酒吧裡喝一瓶香檳放縱一下。

sentences.en: As a salesman, you need infinite patience to persuade people into buying your products.
sentences.cn: 作為一名推銷員，你要有極大的耐心來勸說人們購買你的產品。

sentences.en: After inheriting an large fortune from his uncle, he bought an estate in the country.
sentences.cn: 從叔叔那裡繼承大筆財產之後，他在鄉下購置了一處房產。

sentences.en: The book his brother bought for him initiated him into the mysteries of science.
sentences.cn: 哥哥給他買的那本書讓他初步瞭解科學的奧祕。

sentences.en: He seems to have indefinite faith in the medicine his son bought from that inland town.
sentences.cn: 對於兒子從那個內陸城鎮買來的藥，他似乎是有著極大的信心。

sentences.en: The owner of the bookstore flew into a fury when he was told innumerable books were burnt in the fire.
sentences.cn: 得知無數的書籍在大火中焚毀，那位書店老闆怒不可遏。

sentences.en: The young mother inquired of the salesgirl where to buy milk powder.
sentences.cn: 那位年輕的母親詢問女店員在哪裡可以買到奶粉。

sentences.en: Please send these goods to the agricultural institute with frantic haste.
sentences.cn: 請把這些商品從速送到農學院。

sentences.en: The businessman insured himself for three thousand dollars.
sentences.cn: 那位商人為自己投保三千美元的人壽保險。

sentences.en: The young couple were intent on buying an apartment.
sentences.cn: 那對年輕夫婦一心一意地要買一棟公寓。

sentences.en: Maybe we can expect cheap fares of airlines without interference from the government.
sentences.cn: 如果沒有政府干預，我們也許可以期望航空公司設定便宜的票價。

sentences.en: She looked at the flower with an intent gaze; it is said to grow in the interior of the jungles of Africa.
sentences.cn: 她以專注的目光看著那盆花，據說它是生長在非洲的內地叢林中。

sentences.en: Their words suggested a different interpretation of the sales contract.
sentences.cn: 他們的話表明了對這份銷售合約的不同理解。

sentences.en: The interpreter watched the antique in the shop window with an intent expression.
sentences.cn: 那位譯員以專注的神情看著商店櫥窗裡的古玩。

sentences.en: The man suddenly had an intuition about the gift he wanted to buy.
sentences.cn: 那人突然對自己想要買的禮物有種直覺。

cn: 向內的，內部的，本質上的

sentences.en: Judging by her inward nature, she will not buy those gaudy decorations.
sentences.cn: 從她的個性判斷，她不會買那些花俏的飾物。

sentences.en: As to the reasons why customers seldom come to your store, you should turn your thoughts inwards.
sentences.cn: 至於說為什麼很少有顧客到你的商店來，你應當自省。

sentences.en: She bought a plant which was said to grow on an isle.
sentences.cn: 她買了一株據說是生長在一個小島上的植物。

sentences.en: They took issue with the shopkeeper about the price of the sweater.
sentences.cn: 他們就這件毛衣的價格和那位店主爭論。

sentences.en: Intuition told her what her grandma wanted to buy were seeds of the English ivy.
sentences.cn: 直覺告訴她，奶奶想要買的是常春藤的種子。

sentences.en: Please lift this car with that jack.
sentences.cn: 請用那台起重機抬起這輛汽車。

sentences.en: She had an intuition that there was something wrong with the jade bracelet.
sentences.cn: 她有種直覺，這個玉鐲似乎有些不對。

cn: 看門者，看管房屋的人，鍋爐工

sentences.en: The janitor hailed curses down the kids who ran about at the entrance.
sentences.cn: 那位看門人大罵那些在入口處到處跑的孩子們。

sentences.en: I knew it by intuition that what she felt like buying was jasmine tea.
sentences.cn: 我憑直覺知道，她想買的是茉莉花茶。

sentences.en: When coming out from the bookstore, she heard a driver howl his displeasure at a boy who jaywalked.
sentences.cn: 從那家書店出來的時候，她聽到一位司機對亂穿越馬路的男孩怒吼。

sentences.en: He tried to resist an impulse to jeer at the new dress his wife bought.
sentences.cn: 他試圖遏制自己的衝動，不去嘲諷妻子買的那件新洋裝。

sentences.en: While waiting for his wife at the checkout, the man with an impatient gleam in his eye jingled keys in his hand.
sentences.cn: 在結帳處等候妻子的時候，那個眼中露出不耐的人，手中撥弄著鑰匙，叮噹作響。

sentences.en: The lady who looked jolly wandered in the shopping center from dawn to dusk.
sentences.cn: 那個看起來很愉快的女士在這家購物中心從早逛到晚。

sentences.en: There is sure to be the book about journalism you want to buy in the bookstore.
sentences.cn: 這家書店一定有你想買的那本關於新聞業的書。

sentences.en: The journalist was in his uncontrollable furies when the robbery took place in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 超市中發生搶劫案，那位記者怒不可遏。

sentences.en: The housewife tried to curb an impulse to buy that lovely coffee jug.
sentences.cn: 這位家庭主婦試圖控制自己的衝動，不去買那個漂亮的咖啡壺。

sentences.en: The member of the jury who behaved so badly in the mall went down in our esteem.
sentences.cn: 那位陪審團成員在這家購物中心裡舉止惡劣，我們對他的看法一落千丈。

sentences.en: We found it hard to justify his buying such a large estate.
sentences.cn: 我們無法理解，他怎麼會買這麼大的地產。

sentences.en: To her immense relief, she still had enough money to buy those juvenile books.
sentences.cn: 讓她感到極大安慰的是，她還有足夠的錢買那些少年讀物。

cn: a: 有親屬關係的，同類的

sentences.en: There is still an immense amount of money to buy gifts for your kin.
sentences.cn: 還有很多錢可以買禮物給你的親戚們。

sentences.en: When she saw the comic book in the bookstore, the schoolgirl's eyes kindled with excitement.
sentences.cn: 在書店裡看到這本漫畫書，那個女生的眼中閃現出激動的光芒。

cn: 淵博的，有知識的，聰明的

sentences.en: The bookseller seems to be quite knowledgeable about literature.
sentences.cn: 那位書商似乎對文學極有見地。

sentences.en: He has been buying a Christmas card for his mother every year since he was a lad.
sentences.cn: 從幼時至今，他每年都買一張聖誕賀卡給媽媽。

sentences.en: The lame old man got into a flap because of the shopkeeper's unpleasant expressions.
sentences.cn: 那位跛腳的老人因為店主的不悅目光而忐忑不安。

sentences.en: The landlord bought daily necessities for the young man who suffered great losses and was frantic with grief.
sentences.cn: 那位房東為那個遭受極大損失、悲痛欲絕的年輕人買了些日用品。

sentences.en: The landlady who comes to buy bedclothes seems to be slightly off her rocker.
sentences.cn: 那位來買寢具用品的女房東似乎有點精神失常。

sentences.en: We cannot believe what you say for there to be no bar codes of these products in the store read by lasers.
sentences.cn: 我們無法相信你所說的，這家店裡的產品條碼並不是以雷射識別的。

sentences.en: They seem to allow their daughter too much latitude in spending money.
sentences.cn: 他們似乎是對女兒的零用錢太過放任。

sentences.en: The lawmaker said the imposition of the tax on luxury goods might cause a sharp rise in price.
sentences.cn: 那位立法者說，對奢侈品課稅也許會導致價格急劇上漲。

sentences.en: She did not want to buy that desk because there was a layer of dust on it.
sentences.cn: 她不想買那張桌子，是因為桌子上有一層灰。

sentences.en: The two kinds of products appear to be not in the same league.
sentences.cn: 這兩種產品似乎並不是同一個等級的。

sentences.en: New legislation on the sale of tobacco cast a gloom over the businessman.
sentences.cn: 有關菸草售賣的新法規使得這位商人愁眉不展。

sentences.en: You had better try to lessen the risk of excessive expenditure.
sentences.cn: 你最好盡力減少超支的風險。

sentences.en: She was anxious lest they may fail to balance expenditure with income.
sentences.cn: 她擔心他們會超支。

sentences.en: The lieutenant is demented with worry about the expenditure on weapons.
sentences.cn: 那位陸軍中尉擔心武器方面的開支。

sentences.en: The young man dreamed of having a lifelong job so that he can have enough money to spend.
sentences.cn: 那個年輕人希望有個鐵飯碗，那麼，他就可以有足夠的錢可以用。

sentences.en: There is a strong likelihood that she will buy that sweater.
sentences.cn: 她極有可能買那件毛衣。

sentences.en: There is very little likelihood of his buying much burnt lime.
sentences.cn: 他不可能買很多生石灰。

sentences.en: The man who walked with a slight limp came to buy some lime juice.
sentences.cn: 那個走路有點跛的人來買了一些萊姆汁。

sentences.en: She wanted to go shopping at once, but her husband still lingered long over his meal.
sentences.cn: 她想立即去購物，然而，她的丈夫還在慢吞吞地吃飯。

sentences.en: The likelihood is that they will spend much money on livestock farming.
sentences.cn: 他們可能會花很多錢發展畜牧業。

sentences.en: His brother's words reduced the likelihood that he will buy a lizard as a pet.
sentences.cn: 哥哥的話減少了他買隻蜥蜴作寵物的可能性。

sentences.en: The man who repaired the locomotive had to check an impulse to buy gifts for his daughter.
sentences.cn: 那個修理火車頭的男子克制了想買禮物給女兒的衝動。

sentences.en: An air of gloom settled over the farmer who could not afford the agentia to kill the locusts.
sentences.cn: 那位買不起除蝗藥劑的農民十分憂鬱。

sentences.en: There is no time to linger; let's lodge at the hotel.
sentences.cn: 沒有時間拖延了，我們就住這家旅館吧。

sentences.en: The salesman has a lofty position in the company.
sentences.cn: 那個推銷員在公司裡地位很高。

sentences.en: She bought four paper cups bearing the company's logo.
sentences.cn: 她買了四個印有這家公司標誌的紙杯。

cn: 孤獨的，人跡稀少的，寂寥的

sentences.en: She went shopping all by her lonesome.
sentences.cn: 她獨自去購物。

sentences.en: The gloom deepened as he learnt he cannot go to visit the island whose position was longitude 125 degrees east.
sentences.cn: 得知不能去那個東經一百二十五度的島上觀光，他愈發鬱悶。

cn: 睡蓮，蓮花圖案，蓮屬植物

sentences.en: You can command a broad prospect of lotus flowers in the hotel.
sentences.cn: 在這家旅館可以眺望蓮花的廣闊景色。

sentences.en: The boy rubbed his hands with glee at the thought of buying a lottery ticket.
sentences.cn: 想到要去買樂透，那個男孩開心得直搓手。

sentences.en: The lumber seller was said to have a mind lumbered with idle gossip.
sentences.cn: 據說，那個木材商腦子裡盡是些蜚短流長。

sentences.en: She had a lump in her throat when she found her boyfriend bought a diamond ring for her.
sentences.cn: 發現男朋友買了一枚鑽戒給她，她喉中哽咽。

sentences.en: She magnified the problem of money shortage, hoping to stop her husband buying that car.
sentences.cn: 她誇大了錢財短缺的困難，希望能阻止丈夫買那輛車。

sentences.en: The woman's maiden name is Liu.
sentences.cn: 那個女人的娘家姓劉。

sentences.en: It may cost much money to travel to the island lying off the coast of mainland Britain.
sentences.cn: 去那個遠離英國大陸的島上旅遊也許會花費很多錢。

sentences.en: Entertainment seems to have been absorbed into the mainstream of expenditures.
sentences.cn: 娛樂似乎已經成為消費支出的主流。

sentences.en: The price maintenance may linger on for two weeks.
sentences.cn: 這個價格也許可以保持兩周不變。

sentences.en: He has to find a hotel with majestic views.
sentences.cn: 他必須找間景致優美的旅館。

sentences.en: The majesty of the mountain scenery impressed itself in our memory.
sentences.cn: 壯麗的高山景象給我們留下深刻的印象。

sentences.en: The curator need to collect more money to provide better surroundings for these marine mammals.
sentences.cn: 那位館長需要募集更多的錢來為這些海洋哺乳動物提供更好的環境。

sentences.en: It is manifest to everyone that she bought a jade bracelet last week.
sentences.cn: 大家都知道，上周她買了個玉鐲。

sentences.en: The rich man manifested little interest in buying that mansion.
sentences.cn: 那個富人沒有什麼興趣買那棟大廈。

sentences.en: Carelessness was a lame excuse for your forgetting to buy that maple desk.
sentences.cn: 疏忽並不是你忘記買那張楓木書桌的充分理由。

cn: 邊緣的，臨界的，最低限度的

sentences.en: There is only a marginal improvement in the sale of tobacco.
sentences.cn: 菸草銷售只是輕微好轉。

sentences.en: Marine stores appear to be of marginal interest to the man.
sentences.cn: 那個男人似乎對船用物品不感興趣。

sentences.en: The marshal marshaled his thoughts and decided to increase the expenditure of money on weapons.
sentences.cn: 那位元帥整理了自己的思緒，決定增加購買武器的費用。

sentences.en: When the government imposed martial law, the price of daily necessities sharply increased.
sentences.cn: 政府實行軍事管制時，日用品價格急劇增長。

cn: n: 令人驚奇的事或人

sentences.en: It was a marvel that she should buy such a cheap dress.
sentences.cn: 她居然買了一件這麼便宜的洋裝，真是不可思議。

sentences.en: We marvel that she looks masculine in that garment.
sentences.cn: 我們大為驚異的是，她穿上那件衣服有些男性化。

sentences.en: You go to buy some bangers and mash, and I will perform marvels at the kitchen stove.
sentences.cn: 你去買些香腸和馬鈴薯泥，我來做些美味佳餚。

sentences.en: The masseur gave him a relaxing massage for free.
sentences.cn: 那位按摩師免費為他做放鬆按摩。

sentences.en: The young man bought a massive amount of alcohol yesterday.
sentences.cn: 那個年輕人昨天買了大量的酒。

sentences.en: She wanted to buy a masterpiece of that writer, but her mother treated her request with indifference.
sentences.cn: 她想買那位作家的傑出著作，但她媽媽對她的請求置若罔聞。

sentences.en: Her husband was actually a marvel of patience and he could wait for an hour in line just to buy some mayonnaise.
sentences.cn: 她的丈夫是個極有耐心的人，他可以為了買美乃滋而排一小時的隊。

sentences.en: She went shopping; in the meantime, her daughter stayed at home and watched TV.
sentences.cn: 她去購物，同時，她的女兒在家裡看電視。

sentences.en: Buying jewels is out of my territory, I am only interested in mechanics.
sentences.cn: 我不懂怎樣買寶石，我只對機械學感興趣。

sentences.en: It's difficult to mediate between the buyer and the seller.
sentences.cn: 在買方和賣方之間調停斡旋是困難的。

sentences.en: The novel you bought creates an atmosphere of menace.
sentences.cn: 你買的那本小說營造了一種恐嚇威脅的氛圍。

sentences.en: She bought a story book about the story of the Little Mermaid.
sentences.cn: 她買了一本關於小美人魚的故事書。

sentences.en: A person in our midst should go to buy some butter.
sentences.cn: 我們之中有個人得去買些奶油。

sentences.en: The migrant who bought cotton plantations was said to lose his grip on reality.
sentences.cn: 據說那個購買了棉花種植園的移民不瞭解現實。

sentences.en: His father bought a used car with a low mileage last month.
sentences.cn: 上個月，他爸爸買了一輛行駛里程數少的二手車。

sentences.en: The figure marked a milestone in the history of the sale of rice.
sentences.cn: 這個數字是稻米銷售歷史上的里程碑。

sentences.en: The seller mingled wine with water and sold to customers.
sentences.cn: 那個賣家以水兌酒，賣給顧客。

sentences.en: There is only a minimal amount of risk involved in the sale of daily necessities.
sentences.cn: 出售日用品只有最低限度的風險。

sentences.en: We would like a sprig of mint if it's not too much of an imposition to you.
sentences.cn: 要是不會為你添太多麻煩的話，我們想要一小枝薄荷。

sentences.en: You should never expect the miser to buy you a drink for a change.
sentences.cn: 永遠不要指望讓那個守財奴請你喝一杯。

sentences.en: His daughter always wanted to be mistress of her own affairs, so he did not buy clothes for her.
sentences.cn: 他女兒總是希望自己的事情可以自己做主，所以他沒有買衣服給她。

sentences.en: The boy seems to be always moaning on about how little pocket money he has.
sentences.cn: 那個男孩似乎總是在抱怨零用錢太少。

sentences.en: His friend mocked his attempts to buy that ring.
sentences.cn: 他的朋友嘲笑他自不量力地想買那個戒指。

sentences.en: They had a good moan about the latest mode of the dress.
sentences.cn: 他們對最新款的洋裝抱怨了一番。

sentences.en: There is great mileage in spending money modernizing farming methods.
sentences.cn: 花些錢使耕作方式現代化是十分有益的。

sentences.en: His wife modified her position and agreed to buy that apartment.
sentences.cn: 他妻子改變立場，同意購買那棟公寓。

sentences.en: The lady who always buys books is of gentle mold.
sentences.cn: 那位經常買書的女士性情溫和。

sentences.en: The perfume with activated molecules was regarded as a sign of femininity.
sentences.cn: 這種含有活性分子的香水被視為女性專用。

sentences.en: There is a limit to how much the monarch could spend on weapons.
sentences.cn: 那位君主可以花多少錢來買武器，是有限制的。

sentences.en: It's absolutely monstrous to spend so much money on such inferior goods.
sentences.cn: 花那麼多錢買這麼劣質的東西，真是太不像話了。

sentences.en: The collapse of the department store should be a mortal blow to the man.
sentences.cn: 對於那人來說，百貨公司倒閉是致命的打擊。

sentences.en: My mother asked me to buy some long thread moss, but I forgot it.
sentences.cn: 媽媽要我去買些髮菜，我卻忘記了。

sentences.en: His wife appeared to have not been ready for motherhood.
sentences.cn: 他的妻子似乎還沒有做好當母親的準備。

sentences.en: You had better question his motive in offering to buy that necklace for you.
sentences.cn: 你最好問問清楚，他買那串項鍊給你的動機。

sentences.en: Her mother gave her some money and asked her to send a mound of washing and ironing to the laundry.
sentences.cn: 她媽媽給了她一些錢，讓她把一堆要洗熨的衣服送到洗衣店。

sentences.en: Those travelers buy some mountaineering equipment and plan to mount to the top of that mount.
sentences.cn: 那些遊客買了些登山裝備，打算登上那座山的頂峰。

sentences.en: It's believed that he had an ulterior motive for buying that rotary mower.
sentences.cn: 我們相信，他買那個旋轉式割草機是有種隱祕的動機。

sentences.en: The little girl mumbled that she wanted to buy some sweets.
sentences.cn: 那個小女孩咕噥著說，她想買些糖果。

sentences.en: The man with a muscular body feels disposed for shopping.
sentences.cn: 那個體格健壯的人願意去購物。

sentences.en: He mused that it might take more money to buy that apartment.
sentences.cn: 他沉思著，買那棟公寓的話，也許要花費更多錢。

sentences.en: Tell that to the marines. She bought a mustard sweater.
sentences.cn: 我不相信。她竟然會買一件芥末黃的毛衣。

sentences.en: She muttered away to herself as wandering in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在超市裡閒逛的時候，她獨自嘰嘰咕咕地說個不停。

sentences.en: His wife bought a leg of mutton from the butcher's.
sentences.cn: 他妻子在肉鋪買了羊腿肉。

sentences.en: The book seller who was as keen as mustard recommended the book about ancient Greek myth to her.
sentences.cn: 那位極為熱心的書商向她推薦那本關於古希臘神話的書。

sentences.en: She had been nagging her father all day long to buy her that laptop.
sentences.cn: 她整日地央求爸爸給她買那台筆記型電腦。

sentences.en: It would be naive of us to think that we could afford that apartment.
sentences.cn: 如果我們認為自己買得起那棟公寓，就太天真了。

sentences.en: Being unable to buy that skirt left a nasty taste in the mouth.
sentences.cn: 無力購買那件裙子，讓人覺得恥辱。

sentences.en: She doesn't like to go to that commercial district because she hates to navigate with difficulty through the crowd.
sentences.cn: 她不喜歡去那個商業區，是因為她討厭在人群中艱難前行。

sentences.en: The betting was that people would not buy such milk products after listening to the newscast.
sentences.cn: 聽過這個新聞廣播之後，很有可能人們都不會再買這些乳製品。

sentences.en: She nagged her sister for a new dress, while her sister just nibbled at the sandwich.
sentences.cn: 她不停央求姊姊買一件新洋裝給她，她姊姊只是漫不經心地咬著三明治。

sentences.en: Learning that the miser would not spend a nickel on food gave us a nasty shock.
sentences.cn: 得知那個吝嗇鬼連五分鎳幣都不捨得花在食物上，我們大為震驚。

sentences.en: She nagged her boyfriend into buying a nightingale for her.
sentences.cn: 她不斷央求男朋友給她買一隻夜鶯。

sentences.en: We nominated you to do the shopping.
sentences.cn: 我們提議你去購物。

sentences.en: The problem of money shortage has been nagging him for weeks; nonetheless, he did not tell it to his wife.
sentences.cn: 錢財短缺的問題已經困擾了他幾個星期，但他沒有和妻子說。

sentences.en: They assumed that they could tackle the problem with the seller through nonviolent communication.
sentences.cn: 他們以為透過非暴力的溝通，就能解決與那位賣家的問題。

sentences.en: Their luxurious habits stunk in our nostrils.
sentences.cn: 他們奢侈的習慣令我們極為厭惡。

sentences.en: The notable writer made an absolute mint of money in the sale of the novel.
sentences.cn: 那位著名作家出售這部小說，賺了一大筆錢。

sentences.en: They expected noticeable improvement in the sale of jewelry.
sentences.cn: 他們期待珠寶銷售額有明顯的改善。

sentences.en: You had better notify the school report card to his family as soon as possible.
sentences.cn: 你最好儘快將這份成績單告知他的家人。

sentences.en: His girlfriend appeared to have not the slightest notion of the price of the bracelet.
sentences.cn: 他女朋友似乎一點都不知道這個手鐲的價格。

sentences.en: The novice salesman appeared to have a nasty temper.
sentences.cn: 那個新售貨員似乎脾氣不好。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper has got nowhere with the sale of milk products by now.
sentences.cn: 到目前為止，那位店主的乳製品銷售並沒有什麼進展。

sentences.en: The one thousand books bought last week form the nucleus of the library.
sentences.cn: 上周買的一千本書是這個圖書館的核心部分。

cn: a: 裸的，無裝飾的，無效的

sentences.en: The nude statue bought by him was nowhere to be found.
sentences.cn: 他買的那個裸體雕塑找不到了。

sentences.en: She surely knew what gifts to buy for us, so you needn't shove your oar in.
sentences.cn: 她當然知道要買什麼禮物給我們，所以你不必干涉。

sentences.en: The bookstore should be an oasis of calm in the noisy commercial district.
sentences.cn: 在喧鬧的商業區，這個書店應是一方寧靜之地。

sentences.en: I will not buy that jade bracelet, on my oath.
sentences.cn: 我發誓，我不會買那個玉鐲。

sentences.en: When his wife wanted to buy some oatmeal, he did not stick his oar in.
sentences.cn: 他的妻子想買些燕麥片，他沒有干預。

sentences.en: Her mother wanted the oblong table, but she had no notion of its price.
sentences.cn: 她媽媽想買這張長方形的桌子，但她不知道價格。

sentences.en: Observers noted the noticeable change in the price of daily necessities these two months.
sentences.cn: 觀察員記下這兩個月日用品價格的顯著變化。

sentences.en: There is a very obstinate streak in the man who wants to buy a desk.
sentences.cn: 那個想買書桌的人很固執。

sentences.en: Robbery seems to be of frequent occurrence in the commercial district.
sentences.cn: 這個商業區似乎經常發生搶劫事件。

sentences.en: The octopus bought by his father was nowhere to be seen.
sentences.cn: 他爸爸買的那隻章魚不見了。

sentences.en: The odds are in his favor because he is more experienced in selling daily goods.
sentences.cn: 他對於日用品的銷售更有經驗，所以可能會成功。

sentences.en: There is an odor of antiquity in the bookstore.
sentences.cn: 這家書店有種古色古香的格調。

sentences.en: It's a waste of money buying so many olives.
sentences.cn: 買這麼多橄欖是浪費錢。

sentences.en: Opponents of the price increase in eggs hurled a few oaths at the seller.
sentences.cn: 那些反對雞蛋價格上漲的人對那個賣家咒罵幾句。

sentences.en: The young man was full of optimism about the future despite having no money to buy a house.
sentences.cn: 雖然那個年輕人沒錢買房，對未來卻很樂觀。

sentences.en: His father was such an optimist that he believed he can buy all kinds of fruits in the orchard.
sentences.cn: 他爸爸十分樂觀，他相信能在這個果園裡買到所有品種的水果。

sentences.en: They were always at odds with the organizer over the expenditure.
sentences.cn: 他們常常為開支問題而與組織者爭吵。

sentences.en: Tea and spices from the Orient once were in good odor with the aristocracy.
sentences.cn: 東方國家的茶葉和香料一度很受貴族階級的歡迎。

sentences.en: It's odds that his uncle will buy a painting with a typical feature of oriental art.
sentences.cn: 他叔叔可能會買一幅具有東方藝術典型風格的畫。

sentences.en: You had better not buy that clock which is simply for ornament.
sentences.cn: 你最好不要買那個只是作裝飾用的鐘。

sentences.en: They had a notion that the child from the orphanage stole money from the store.
sentences.cn: 他們以為那個從孤兒院來的孩子在這家店偷錢。

sentences.en: It made no odds to me whether you buy that dress trimmed with ostrich feathers.
sentences.cn: 你是否買那件飾有鴕鳥羽毛的洋裝，與我無關。

sentences.en: If he possessed an ounce of business sense, his store would not go into bankruptcy.
sentences.cn: 如果他有一點做生意的常識，他的商店就不會倒閉。

sentences.en: Not to be outdone, she was determined to make more money to buy a better apartment.
sentences.cn: 不想被人超過，她決定賺更多的錢，買一棟更好的公寓。

sentences.en: The shopkeeper appeared to have never been an outgoing type.
sentences.cn: 那個店主似乎並不是好交際的人。

sentences.en: It's noticeable that they should increase the literary output to meet demand.
sentences.cn: 很明顯，為了滿足需求，他們要增加出版物數量。

cn: 門外漢，不大可能獲勝的人

sentences.en: Just as the saying goes, the outsider sees the most of the game; you can ask your boyfriend about his opinion of the necklace.
sentences.cn: 正如俗語所說，旁觀者清，你可以問問你男朋友對那條項鍊的看法。

sentences.en: They bought a house on the outskirts of London last month.
sentences.cn: 他們上個月在倫敦市郊買了一棟房子。

sentences.en: To all outward appearances, the boy who bought a sandwich was happy.
sentences.cn: 從外表來看，那個買了三明治的男孩很高興。

sentences.en: The man who looked outwards bought many books in mint condition.
sentences.cn: 那個向外看的人買了很多嶄新的書。

sentences.en: The overall cost of the computer including tax was four hundred dollars.
sentences.cn: 這台電腦的總價格，含稅在內，是四百美元。

sentences.en: Her mother appeared to overdo the worries about the expenditure.
sentences.cn: 她的媽媽似乎是太過擔心開支了。

sentences.en: The odds are that he will overeat tonight because he bought many delicious snacks just now.
sentences.cn: 今晚他可能會吃得過多，因為他剛剛買了很多好吃的零食。

sentences.en: The market was overflowing with milk products, so the price was comparatively low.
sentences.cn: 市場上充溢著乳製品，所以其價格相對較低。

sentences.en: She overheard her mother saying that she wanted to buy a new cupboard.
sentences.cn: 她無意中聽到媽媽說，想買個新碗櫃。

sentences.en: I overheard him saying that he overslept and forgot to do the shopping.
sentences.cn: 我無意中聽到他說，他睡過頭且忘記要去買東西。

sentences.en: The girl was overwhelmed with joy when her mother bought her a laptop.
sentences.cn: 媽媽給她買了一台筆記型電腦，那個女孩不勝歡喜。

sentences.en: There was not an ounce of possibility that he can get enough money to buy that house unless he continued to overwork.
sentences.cn: 他沒有半分可能湊到足夠的錢買那棟房子，除非他繼續加班工作。

cn: 牡蠣，守祕密的人，沉默寡言的人

sentences.en: He was as dumb as an oyster, so I did not know whether he wanted to buy the jacket.
sentences.cn: 他沉默不語，所以我不知道他是否想買這件夾克。

sentences.en: His wife wanted to go on a trip and breathe in that ozone of seaside; he did not put in his oar.
sentences.cn: 他妻子想去旅行，呼吸海邊的清新空氣，他沒有干預。

sentences.en: The lady who was of pacific disposition went shopping with her sister yesterday.
sentences.cn: 昨天，那位性情溫和的女士和妹妹一起去購物。

sentences.en: The beggar was overwhelmed with gratitude when she bought a packet of biscuits for him.
sentences.cn: 她買了一小包餅乾給那位乞丐，他感激不已。

sentences.en: If you had used your common sense, you would not have bought such a paddle.
sentences.cn: 如果你有常識，就不會買這樣的球拍。

sentences.en: We lay odds of three to one that he will not buy that pane of glass.
sentences.cn: 我們以三比一的賠率打賭，他不會買那塊窗玻璃。

sentences.en: It's a paradox that the miser would spend so much money helping the earthquake victims.
sentences.cn: 那個吝嗇鬼居然會花那麼多錢幫助地震災民，真是矛盾。

sentences.en: When you go shopping, you can drive along the road which is parallel to the railway.
sentences.cn: 去購物的時候，你可以開車沿那條與鐵路平行的路行駛。

sentences.en: She paddled her own canoe and bought an ice-cream parlor.
sentences.cn: 她靠自己的努力，買了一家冰淇淋店。

sentences.en: His father was an active participant in commodity transactions.
sentences.cn: 他的爸爸積極參與商品交易。

sentences.en: Actually, he has not a particle of malice in persuading you to buy that vase.
sentences.cn: 事實上，他勸你買那個花瓶並沒有什麼惡意。

sentences.en: She did not want to buy that desk partly because of dust particles on it.
sentences.cn: 她不想買那個書桌，有一部分原因是因為它上面有灰塵。

cn: 熱情的，激昂的，易被情慾所支配的

sentences.en: There was not a particle of love in his buying roses for the passionate lady.
sentences.cn: 他給那位易動感情的女士送花，並沒有半點愛意在內。

sentences.en: Photography, her favourite pastime, costs her a packet.
sentences.cn: 攝影是她最喜歡的消遣方式，也花了她一大筆錢。

sentences.en: The man has not an ounce of sincerity in buying the pastries for his grandma.
sentences.cn: 那人買酥皮糕點給祖母，並沒有半分誠心。

sentences.en: She would sew a patch onto the knee of her son's trousers rather than buy new trousers for him.
sentences.cn: 她寧願在兒子的褲子膝蓋處補補丁，也不願買新褲子給他。

sentences.en: It was patent to us that she likes to buy patent drugs.
sentences.cn: 我們都知道，她喜歡買專利藥物。

sentences.en: There was a feeling of optimism in the sale of that patriot's albums.
sentences.cn: 對於那位愛國人士的專輯銷售前景，人們的看法十分樂觀。

sentences.en: A thousand dollars should go nowhere when you buy patrol cars.
sentences.cn: 要買巡邏車的話，一千美元也不算什麼。

sentences.en: It's of immense importance to deal with those patrons.
sentences.cn: 和那些老主顧打交道是極為重要的。

sentences.en: The lady who was as proud as a peacock always bought many fashionable clothes.
sentences.cn: 那位高傲的女士總是買很多時裝。

sentences.en: Against all the odds, the peasant woman finally bought a house.
sentences.cn: 經過重重困難，那位農村婦女最終買了一間房子。

sentences.en: Her mother bought a white dog last week, but it caused a peck of trouble to her family.
sentences.cn: 她媽媽上周買了一隻白色的狗，但牠給她的家人帶來許多麻煩。

sentences.en: She bought a black cat with a white patch on its neck from that peddler.
sentences.cn: 她從那個小販手中買了一隻脖子上帶白色斑點的黑色貓咪。

sentences.en: The thief peeked into the shop window at the antique.
sentences.cn: 那個小偷隔著商店櫥窗向裡偷看那件古玩。

sentences.en: The salesgirl made a mistake in the bill, which offered the customer a peg to hang his complaint on.
sentences.cn: 那位女店員弄錯帳單，使得那位客人有了不滿的理由。

sentences.en: A shrill cry suddenly penetrated the silence in the bookstore.
sentences.cn: 突然，一聲尖叫劃破了這家書店中的寂靜。

sentences.en: She perceived a change in the price of agricultural products.
sentences.cn: 她發現，農產品的價格有所變化。

sentences.en: The parrot bought by his sister perched on the windowsill after giving him a sharp peck on the hand.
sentences.cn: 姊姊買的那隻鸚鵡狠狠地啄了他的手之後，停留在窗臺上。

sentences.en: The performer bought daily necessities for the earthquake victims.
sentences.cn: 那位演員為那些地震災民購置日用品。

sentences.en: If you choose the product, you should face the possible perils of color fading.
sentences.cn: 如果選擇這種產品，你會面臨產品褪色的風險。

sentences.en: He decided to buy the car; he shall do it or perish in the attempt, anyway.
sentences.cn: 他決定買那輛汽車，不論如何，拼死一搏。

sentences.en: It's permissible for consumers to slightly increase the price of the daily goods.
sentences.cn: 日用品價格輕微上漲，對於消費者而言，是可以的。

sentences.en: They persisted with the price increase despite opposition from consumers.
sentences.cn: 他們不顧消費者的反對，堅持漲價。

sentences.en: The personnel officer perceived that she can purchase train tickets at reduced price.
sentences.cn: 那位人事部負責人知道，她可以買到優惠價的火車票。

sentences.en: There is a mood of pessimism in the manager about the sale of these cotton goods.
sentences.cn: 對於這些棉紡織品的銷售，那名經理很悲觀。

sentences.en: The seller who sold snacks along the pier was perceived to have difficulty in walking.
sentences.cn: 據觀察所見，那個在碼頭附近賣零食的人，走路有些困難。

sentences.en: The pilgrim pegged the landlord down to a price for the room.
sentences.cn: 那位朝聖者已經和店主談妥了房間的價格。

sentences.en: In order to get enough money to buy the house, he went from pillar to post.
sentences.cn: 為了借到足夠的錢買房，他到處奔走碰壁。

sentences.en: The teenager with a pimple on his face had the hardihood to deny he stole the foods in the shop.
sentences.cn: 那個臉上有粉刺的少年厚顏無恥地否認他偷了商店裡的食物。

sentences.en: If it comes to the pinch, you can sell your apartment to get money.
sentences.cn: 必要時，你可以把公寓賣掉來籌錢。

sentences.en: He was pissed around for three days before they finally agreed to the price.
sentences.cn: 他們浪費了三天時間，才同意這個價格。

sentences.en: It's marvelous how he wanted to buy an automatic pistol for his son.
sentences.cn: 他怎麼會買一支自動手槍送給兒子，真是不可思議。

sentences.en: He avoided his sister like the plague in case she tried to borrow some money from him.
sentences.cn: 他極力迴避妹妹，以免她試圖向他借錢。

sentences.en: He notified his wife that he would buy some bananas in the plantation.
sentences.cn: 他告知妻子，他想在種植園裡買一些香蕉。

sentences.en: To make sure to get the playwright's autograph book, he offered over the odds for it.
sentences.cn: 為了確保買到那位劇作家的簽名冊，他出了高價。

sentences.en: She refused to buy that bracelet on the plea that she could not afford it.
sentences.cn: 她以無力負擔為由，拒絕購買那個手鐲。

sentences.en: The little girl pleaded her mother to buy the doll.
sentences.cn: 那個小女孩請求媽媽買那個洋娃娃。

sentences.en: You should give a pledge never to tell others that he would buy his wife a ring secretly.
sentences.cn: 你要保證，不告訴別人他要偷偷買戒指給妻子。

sentences.en: The farmer took it with a pinch of salt that his wife bought that plow at such a low price.
sentences.cn: 妻子用這樣低的價格買了犁，那位農夫對此半信半疑。

sentences.en: He plucked a rose for me from his garden, and then asked me to pay one dollar.
sentences.cn: 他從花園裡為我摘了一朵玫瑰，然後要我付一美元。

sentences.en: The two brothers were plunged into debt because of their extravagant lifestyle.
sentences.cn: 那兩兄弟因為奢侈的生活方式而負債。

sentences.en: The inflation will be most likely to hit the pocketbook of consumers.
sentences.cn: 通貨膨脹極有可能影響消費者的購買力。

sentences.en: She was so naive as to believe she could buy the entire poetic output of the famous poet.
sentences.cn: 她以為自己可以買到那位著名詩人的全部詩作，真是天真。

sentences.en: The twin sisters bought some chips and poked at them unenthusiastically.
sentences.cn: 那對雙胞胎姊妹買了些薯條，無精打采地撥弄著。

sentences.en: They made a packet with this kind of fish produced in the polar region and bought a villa.
sentences.cn: 他們靠這種產自極區的魚賺了大錢，買了一棟別墅。

sentences.en: She gave her boyfriend a quick peck on the cheek when he bought a bunch of roses and waited at the porch of her house.
sentences.cn: 男朋友買了一束玫瑰等在她家門廊處，她在他臉頰上飛快地吻了一下。

sentences.en: The two brothers bought a novel which was a potential best seller.
sentences.cn: 那兩兄弟買了一本有望成為暢銷書的小說。

sentences.en: Most consumers seem to be pissed off with the price increase in poultry and eggs.
sentences.cn: 多數消費者似乎都對禽蛋類的價格變化感到厭煩。

sentences.en: He plucked up courage to tell his parent that he bought a prairie last week.
sentences.cn: 他鼓起勇氣告訴父母，上周他買了一處牧場。

sentences.en: The vicar who preached well did not want to know about his family living expenses.
sentences.cn: 那位講道講得很好的牧師對家庭生活開支不聞不問。

sentences.en: By way of precaution, he bought some food and vegetables in advance.
sentences.cn: 小心起見，他提前買了些食物和蔬菜。

sentences.en: Choosing clothes should be a matter of preference.
sentences.cn: 挑選衣服是取決於個人愛好的事情。

sentences.en: Her ideas on food and clothes appear to be prehistoric.
sentences.cn: 她對於衣食的觀念是老舊的。

sentences.en: She did not recognize the potential for boom conditions prevailing in the region.
sentences.cn: 她沒有意識到在這個地區生意興隆的可能性。

sentences.en: The news that they can attend the preview of the fashion collection plunged them into excitement.
sentences.cn: 可以去參加這次的時裝預演的消息使他們十分興奮。

sentences.en: The thought that she was an easy prey for the dishonest salesman preyed on her mind.
sentences.cn: 想起自己那麼輕易地被那個奸商敲竹槓，她就十分懊惱。

sentences.en: When he lost that priceless treasure, he felt like such an idiot.
sentences.cn: 弄丟那件無價之寶，他覺得自己蠢極了。

sentences.en: The latest sale figures pricked the bubble of his complacency about the prospect of the clothes.
sentences.cn: 最新的銷售數額打破了他對於這些衣物銷售前景大好的美夢。

sentences.en: There should be no price changes without the prior approval of consumers' association.
sentences.cn: 在消費者協會同意之前，價格不得有所改變。

sentences.en: Purchasing a comfortable apartment should be a top priority.
sentences.cn: 當務之急是買一棟舒適的公寓。

sentences.en: Seeing a procession of customers coming to his store, he cannot help pinching himself in case it was all a dream.
sentences.cn: 看到顧客絡繹不絕地來到自己的商店中，他忍不住捏自己一下，生怕這只是一場夢。

sentences.en: His wife muttered to him about the stamp she wanted to buy on which the chairman's head appear in profile.
sentences.cn: 他妻子低聲對他說，她想買的那枚郵票上有主席的頭像。

sentences.en: She pinched and scraped so that she could buy the drugs to help her father to prolong life.
sentences.cn: 她省吃儉用，以便買藥來幫父親延長壽命。

cn: v: 支撐，使倚靠在某物上

sentences.en: When she wanted to buy that car, her husband's support was a great prop to her determination.
sentences.cn: 她想買那輛車的時候，丈夫的支持大大地堅定她的決心。

sentences.en: Don't get into a fuss about nothing; if you believed a prophet of doom, you would never start the business.
sentences.cn: 不要自尋煩惱，如果你相信那些悲觀論調，這生意就永遠都不可能起步。

sentences.en: His son wanted to be his own master and spent a large proportion of his salary on photography.
sentences.cn: 他的兒子想要自己做主，把大部分的薪水都用於攝影上。

sentences.en: The prospects for this season's sales of cars appear to be poor.
sentences.cn: 這一季的汽車銷售，前景似乎不佳。

sentences.en: How to persuade him to buy the product is outside my province.
sentences.cn: 怎麼說服他買產品不在我的職責範圍內。

sentences.en: I'm afraid next month’s expenditure will have to be drastically pruned.
sentences.cn: 恐怕下個月的開支必須大幅度削減。

sentences.en: The sales manager wants to launch an advertising campaign to publicize the new product, hoping others will not stick in their oar.
sentences.cn: 銷售經理想為新產品展開宣傳活動，希望其他人不會干預。

sentences.en: The boy bought a hamburger and vanished in a puff of smoke.
sentences.cn: 那個男孩買了漢堡，就一溜煙地不見了。

sentences.en: If you want to start the business, you should have your finger on the pulse.
sentences.cn: 如果你想做這件生意，就要充分掌握最新情況。

sentences.en: The man's motive for purchasing these household appliances laid hidden.
sentences.cn: 那人購買這些家用設施的動機並不明確。

sentences.en: They began to regret the purchase of tins when they saw the pyramid of fruits in the store.
sentences.cn: 在這家店裡看到擺成金字塔形的水果，他們後悔買了那些罐頭。

sentences.en: The quack who always sold substandard medicine was in bad odor.
sentences.cn: 那個總是賣假藥的庸醫聲名狼藉。

sentences.en: The coupon will qualify you to get ten dollars off.
sentences.cn: 這張優惠券可以讓你少付十美元。

sentences.en: The businessman who was in ill odor came to buy a quart of vodka.
sentences.cn: 那個聲名狼藉的商人來買了一夸脫的伏特加。

sentences.en: The elderly man spends all his life in quest of buying antiques.
sentences.cn: 那個老年人畢生都在追求買古董。

sentences.en: She quivered at the price which was out of all proportion to income.
sentences.cn: 看到與收入完全不成比例的高價，她微微顫抖。

sentences.en: The hungry old man took a peek at the toast rack in the bakery.
sentences.cn: 那位饑餓的老人偷偷看著麵包店裡的麵包架。

sentences.en: She was quite puffed by the time she got home with a bunch of radishes bought from the market.
sentences.cn: 提著從市場上買的一捆蘿蔔回到家時，她氣喘得厲害。

sentences.en: There are two supermarkets within a radius of five miles.
sentences.cn: 周圍五英里的半徑範圍內，有兩家超市。

sentences.en: Ragged old men should be common occurrence in the supermarket.
sentences.cn: 在這個超市裡經常看到衣著襤褸的老人。

sentences.en: Our budget of this month completely went off the rails after you bought that ring.
sentences.cn: 你買了那枚戒指之後，我們這個月的預算開支就完全被打亂了。

sentences.en: Her spirits rallied on hearing that her daughter bought a bunch of carnations for her.
sentences.cn: 聽說女兒買一束康乃馨給她，她又振作起精神了。

sentences.en: The man who fell into bad odor had to sell the cattle ranch to buy a house.
sentences.cn: 那個聲名狼藉的人只得賣掉那個牧牛場來買房子。

sentences.en: That rascal won't come to our store again, I trust.
sentences.cn: 但願那個流氓不會再到我們店裡來。

sentences.en: Female customers outnumbered male customers here in the ratio of four to one.
sentences.cn: 這裡的女性顧客以四比一的比率多於男性顧客。

sentences.en: She kept rattling on about expenditures, but nothing.
sentences.cn: 她圍繞著費用開支什麼的喋喋不休，卻是言之無物。

sentences.en: A good prospect of sales might not be beyond the realms of possibility.
sentences.cn: 好的銷售前景也並非是沒有可能的。

sentences.en: Buying his son a car might be within the realms of possibility after reaping a field of wheat.
sentences.cn: 收割田地裡的麥子之後，也許能湊夠錢買車給兒子。

sentences.en: On the way to the rear entrance of the supermarket, his theme was moving into the realms of literature.
sentences.cn: 向超市後面的入口處去的時候，他的話題轉到了文學的境域。

sentences.en: The businessman purchased a large number of estates with reckless abandon.
sentences.cn: 那個商人恣意地購置大量地產。

sentences.en: He reckoned that the price of milk products was a little too high.
sentences.cn: 他認為，乳製品的價格有點過高了。

sentences.en: I'm not the person to recommend how to get enough money for that apartment.
sentences.cn: 對於如何為那棟公寓湊到足夠的錢，我並不能為此出什麼主意。

sentences.en: You had better not reckon on him to buy that coral reef for you.
sentences.cn: 你最好不要指望他買那個珊瑚礁給你。

sentences.en: When they got home from the supermarket, they suddenly realized they had reckoned without the cotton reel.
sentences.cn: 從超市回到家的時候，他們突然意識到忘記買棉線軸了。

sentences.en: The referee reckoned that hire charges should be reckoned from the date of delivery.
sentences.cn: 那位調解人認為，租金應當是自貨到之日算起。

sentences.en: When collecting money to build the refuge for the homeless, they had many difficulties to reckon with.
